title: (x) Mads Nørgaard, Danish fashion design - custom face by e-types {Ulli Neutzling}
content:
Hi all, could you say what fonts this is:

[www.madsnorgaard.dk](http://web.archive.org/web/20080614063916/http:/www.madsnorgaard.dk/ "www.madsnorgaard.dk")

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [what.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080614063916/http:/typophile.com/files/what.jpg) | 47.84 KB |

 [‹ (x) Couture elegant script - Sloop Script {Jan E}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080614063916/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39927 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Raised account numbers on credit cards - custom OCR face {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080614063916/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39933 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Multipleks

comments.content: seems they use a custom typeface like most projects from [e-types](http://web.archive.org/web/20080614063916/http:/www.e-types.com/).
It’s very close to Franklin Gothic Heavy
Franklin Gothic has a contrast in stroke width. This one doesn’t.
Yeah. It’s close but not a match. N is too wide, E and F are too narrow, too.

Thanks, all. And thanks for the e-type link, I wasn’t aware of them. I see they have some typefaces up at [http://www.e-types.com/playtype/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080614063916/http:/www.e-types.com/playtype/ "http://www.e-types.com/playtype/")
